intro: Phaeocephalum decurrens, commonly known as the running false heather, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is typically evergreen, with leaves that are narrow and pointed, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
